page.title: X2:The Threat - Command Descriptions
page.command:
Copies a subset of elements from ARRAY $2x into ARRAY $0y. The elements at indicies $3x, $4y and all elements in between, are copied from ARRAY $2x into element $1z and all subsequent elements of ARRAY $0y
You can copy all the elements in ARRAY $2x with this command or just a subset. The order of the copied elements is not changed.
{HEADING:Information}
The ARRAY $2x is not resized by this command, you must ensure it is large enough to hold all the required elements. All ARRAY indicies are zero based.
Stores the value $1 in a new element added to the end of the ARRAY $0.

Loops through each number $0 between and including the numbers $1x and $2y, increasing or decreasing with each iteration by the INTEGER $3.
If the INTEGER $3 is positive the count increases with each iteration, and if $3 is negative the count decreases with each iteration.
{ABOUT_MACROS}
{VARIABLE:$iterator} = $1x ± $3 {KEYWORD:while} {VARIABLE:$iterator} < $2y \t{VARIABLE:$iterator} = {VARIABLE:$iterator} ± $3 \t...
Returns a random INTEGER that could be zero, the INTEGER $1, or any INTEGER in between
Returns a random INTEGER that could be the INTEGER $1x, the INTEGER $2y or any INTEGER in between
Sets the co-ordinates of the SECTOROBJECT $0.
Sets the co-ordinates of the SECTOROBJECT $0. If another OBJ is already occupying this space, the SECTOROBJECT $0 is placed nearby.

Sets the {PROPERTY:yaw}, {PROPERTY:pitch} and {PROPERTY:roll} of the SECTOROBJECT $0.
{ABOUT_OBJECT_ROTATION}

Sets the {PROPERTY:local variable} with the name $1, stored the OBJ $0, to the value $2.
{ABOUT_LOCAL_AND_GLOBAL_VARIABLES}

Returns the value of the {PROPERTY:local variable} with the name $1, stored on the OBJ $0.
{ABOUT_LOCAL_AND_GLOBAL_VARIABLES}
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is permitted to dock at the {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION $2, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Informs the OBJ $0 that it is currently executing the {TYPE:command} $1 and should display the {PROPERTY:command name} to the user.
{HEADING:Information}
This command does not order the OBJ $0 to execute the {TYPE:command} $1, it only displays the {PROPERTY:command name} to the user.
This command can only be executed by an OBJ upon itself, using {VARIABLE:\[THIS\]}.

Returns the {TYPE:command} currently being executed by the OBJ $0.
This must have been previously set by the {COMMAND:set command:} command or activated by the user through the user interface.

Informs the OBJ $0 that the {PROPERTY:primary target} of the {TYPE:command} it is executing is the OBJ $1, and displays this information to the user.
{HEADING:Information}
This does not change the true {PROPERTY:target} of the current {TYPE:command}, it only displays the {PROPERTY:primary command target} to the user.
This command can only be executed by an OBJ upon itself, using {VARIABLE:\[THIS\]}.

Returns the {PROPERTY:primary target} of the {TYPE:command} currently being executed by the OBJ $0.
This must have been previously set using the {COMMAND:set command target:} command.

Informs the OBJ $0 that the {PROPERTY:secondary target} of the {TYPE:command} it is executing is the OBJ $1, and displays this information to the user.
{HEADING:Information}
This does not change the true {PROPERTY:target} of the current {TYPE:command}, it only displays the {PROPERTY:secondary command target} to the user.
This command can only be executed by an OBJ upon itself, using {VARIABLE:\[THIS\]}.

Returns the {PROPERTY:secondary target} of the {TYPE:command} currently being executed by the OBJ $0.
This must have been previously set by the {COMMAND:set command target2:} command.
Returns the nearest MISSILE aiming at the OBJ $0, if any, otherwise it returns NULL.

Returns the number of SUBTYPES within the MAINTYPE $1.
{ABOUT_MAINTYPES_AND_SUBTYPES}
Returns the RACE that is the {PROPERTY:owner} of the OBJ $0.

Returns the current {PROPERTY:environment} of the OBJ $0.
{ABOUT_ENVIRONMENT}

Returns the SECTOR containing the OBJ $0.
If $0 is a SHIP that is DOCKED, then this command returns the SECTOR containing the {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION within which $0 is DOCKED.

Determines whether the OBJ $0 has been destroyed.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 exists, and FALSE otherwise.
Retrieves the WARE corresponding to the OBJ $0. If the OBJ $0 is not represented by any WARE, this command returns {TYPE:Unknown Object}.

Determines whether the OBJ $0 is a specific OBJTYPE, such as {OBJECT:Argon Buster} or {OBJECT:Royal Boron Trading Station}.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is of the OBJTYPE $2, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Returns the current {PROPERTY:shield energy} of the OBJ $0, in {UNITS:Joules}.
{RELATED_GAME_OBJECT_LIST:Shields,Shields}

Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:shield energy} of the OBJ $0, in {UNITS:Joules}.
{RELATED_GAME_OBJECT_LIST:Shields,Shields}

Returns the current {PROPERTY:laser energy} of the LASER currently in use by the OBJ $0, in {UNITS:Joules}.
{RELATED_GAME_OBJECT_LIST:Lasers,Lasers}

Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:laser energy} of the LASER currently in use by the OBJ $0, in {UNITS:Joules}.
{RELATED_GAME_OBJECT_LIST:Lasers,Lasers}
%1%0 get max. shield type that can be installed
%1%0 get max. laser type that can be installed

Returns the maximum number of SHIELDS that can be installed on the OBJ $0.
{RELATED_GAME_OBJECT_LIST:Shields,Shields}

Returns the maximum number of LASERS that can be installed on the OBJ $0.
{RELATED_GAME_OBJECT_LIST:Lasers,Lasers}
Returns the most powerful MISSILE WARE that can be installed on the SHIP $0.
Returns whether the OBJ $2 is a {PROPERTY:friend}, {PROPERTY:enemy} or {PROPERTY:neutral} towards the OBJ $2.
Returns whether the {PROPERTY:owner race} of the OBJ $0 is generally a {PROPERTY:friend}, {PROPERTY:enemy} or {PROPERTY:neutral} towards the RACE $2.

Determines the {PROPERTY:relationship} between two {TYPE:objects}. Return TRUE if the OBJ $0 is an {PROPERTY:enemy} of the object $2, otherwise FALSE.
{RELATED_SCRIPT_OBJECT_LIST:Relations,Relations}

Determines the {PROPERTY:relationship} between two {TYPE:objects}. Return TRUE if the OBJ $0 is a {PROPERTY:friend} of the object $2, otherwise FALSE.
{RELATED_SCRIPT_OBJECT_LIST:Relations,Relations}

Determines the {PROPERTY:relationship} between two {TYPE:objects}. Return TRUE if the OBJ $0 is {PROPERTY:neutral} towards the object $2, otherwise FALSE.
{RELATED_SCRIPT_OBJECT_LIST:Relations,Relations}
Returns the SHIELD in {PROPERTY:bay} $2 of the OBJ $0.
Returns the currently installed LASER in {TYPE:turret 0} of the OBJ $0.

Determines whether the OBJ $0 has the same {PROPERTY:environment} as the OBJ $2.
{ABOUT_ENVIRONMENT}
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is in the same SECTOR as the OBJ $2, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is DOCKED within a STATION or larger SHIP, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Returns FALSE if the OBJ $0 is DOCKED, otherwise it returns TRUE.
Returns the OBJ attacking the OBJ $0, if any, otherwise it returns NULL.

Marks the OBJ $1 as being the {PROPERTY:attacker} of the OBJ $0.
This also occurs automatically when one OBJ attacks another.
Returns the x co-ordinate of the OBJ $0.
Returns the y co-ordinate of the OBJ $0.
Returns the z co-ordinate of the OBJ $0.

Sets the {PROPERTY:relation} of the OBJ $0 towards the OBJ $1 to a {TYPE:relation} $2.
This may have to be done in both directions.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is DOCKED within a STATION or DOCKED outside a STATION, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Returns TRUE if the {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION $0 is physically able to dock at the SHIP $2, otherwise it returns FALSE.{CORRECTION:DrBullwinkle}
{NOT_IMPLEMENTED}
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Retrieves the OBJ represented by the SECTOROBJECT $0.
{ABOUT_SECTOR_OBJECTS}
Sets the co-ordinates of the OBJ $0.

Sets the {PROPERTY:yaw}, {PROPERTY:pitch} and {PROPERTY:roll} of the OBJ $0.
{ABOUT_OBJECT_ROTATION}
Returns the radius of the bounding sphere of the OBJ $0, multiplied by 222.
Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:hull energy} of the OBJ $0.
Returns the current {PROPERTY:hull energy} of the OBJ $0.

Returns the number of SHIPS that can be DOCKED at the {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION $0.
For STATIONS this is fixed at one million.
Returns the number of SHIPS {PROPERTY:docked} within the {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION $0.
{NOT_IMPLEMENTED}
Returns the current {PROPERTY:hull energy} of the OBJ $0 as a percentage.
Returns the current {PROPERTY:shield energy} of the OBJ $0 as a percentage.
Returns the total of the current {PROPERTY:hull energy} and {PROPERTY:shield energy} of the OBJ $0, as a percentage.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is on "final approach" to a STATION, {CLASS:Carrier}, or JUMPGATE, otherwise this command returns FALSE.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is launching from a STATION or {CLASS:Carrier}, otherwise FALSE.

Returns TRUE if a {CLASS:Big Ship} is capable of docking at the OBJ $0 and there is a free docking slot available, otherwise it returns FALSE.
{COMPATIBILITY_1:X2}

Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 can be controlled by {TERMINOLOGY:Race Logic}, otherwise it returns FALSE.
{ABOUT_RACE_LOGIC}

Enables or disables the use of {TERMINOLOGY:Race Logic} on the OBJ $0.
{ABOUT_RACE_LOGIC}

Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 can execute it`s {TERMINOLOGY:Start Action}, otherwise it returns FALSE.
{ABOUT_START_ACTIONS}

Enables or disables the {TERMINOLOGY:Start Action} of the OBJ $0.
{ABOUT_START_ACTIONS}
Returns the {PROPERTY:name} of the OBJ $0.
Sets the {PROPERTY:name} of the OBJ $0 to $1.
Changes the {PROPERTY:owner} of the OBJ $0 to the RACE $1.
Returns the unique code of an OBJ displayed in the {TERMINOLOGY:Sector Map} that is meant to represent it`s registry within the game universe. eg. YM2XL-21.
Returns the number of {UNITS:credits} in the {PROPERTY:account} of the player.

Adds $0 {UNITS:credits} to the {PROPERTY:player account}.
If $0 is a negative INTEGER, the {UNITS:credits} are deducted.
Returns the SHIP containing the player
Causes the player to lose their {PROPERTY:police licence} issued by the RACE $0.

Fires the LASER installed in TURRET $3 of the OBJ $0 at the target OBJ $2.
If the LASER was fired successfully this command returns TRUE.
If the OBJ $2 is not within the {PROPERTY:firing arc} of the LASER, or the LASER is `cooling down` after the last shot, this command returns FALSE.

Transfers the WARE $2 into the cargo bay of the SHIP $0. If the WARE will not fit into the cargo bay of the SHIP, the WARE is destroyed.
This command returns TRUE if the WARE $0 was successfully transferred to the SHIP $0, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Fires the MISSILE WARE $3 at the target OBJ $2.
Returns TRUE if the MISSILE was fired, otherwise this command returns FALSE.

Command the SHIP $0 to launch $2 {OBJECT:Fighter Drones}, either to protect itself or attack the OBJ $3.
If the OBJ $3 is NULL then the {OBJECT:Fighter Drones} will protect the SHIP $0, otherwise they will attack the OBJ $3.
Returns TRUE if the {OBJECT:Fighter Drones} were launched successfully, otherwise this command returns FALSE.

Commands the {OBJECT:Kh`aak Cluster} $0 to break apart.
Returns TRUE if successful, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is the FORMATIONLEADER of a decoupled {OBJECT:Kh`aak Cluster}.
Installs the default SHIELD, LASER and {TYPE:ammunition} WARES to the SHIP $0.

Installs the GUN $1y in {PROPERTY:gun slot} $3x of TURRET $2 on the SHIP $0.
{ABOUT_GUNS_AND_TURRETS}

Commands the SHIP $0 to jump to the SECTOR or JUMPGATE $2.
Return TRUE if successful, otherwise FALSE.

Commands the SHIP $0 to fire a MISSILE on the OBJ $2, if the {PROPERTY:missile fire probability} of the SHIP indicates it is appropriate to do so.
Returns TRUE if a MISSILE was fired, and FALSE otherwise.

Sets the FORMATION of the {PROPERTY:followers} of the SHIP $0 to the FORMATION $1.
{RELATED_SCRIPT_OBJECT_LIST:Formations,Formations}
Removes the SHIP $0 from any FORMATION it may be in.
Returns the SHIP that is the {PROPERTY:leader} of the FORMATION to which the SHIP $0 belongs. If the SHIP $0 belongs to no FORMATION, the command returns NULL.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is in {PROPERTY:follow mode}, and FALSE otherwise.

Sets the {PROPERTY:destination} of the SHIP $0 to the OBJ or SECTOR $1.
This does not change the true {PROPERTY:destination} of the SHIP $0, it only displays the {PROPERTY:destination} to the user.

Returns the OBJ or SECTOR marked as the {PROPERTY:destination} of the SHIP $0.
This must have been previously set by the {COMMAND:set destination to ...} command.

Sets the {PROPERTY:attack target} of the SHIP $0 to the OBJ $1.
This does not change the true {PROPERTY:target} of the SHIP $0, it only displays the {PROPERTY:target} to the user.

Returns the OBJ marked as the {PROPERTY:attack target} of the SHIP $0.
This must have been previously set by the {COMMAND:set attack target} command.

Searches a FORMATION of SHIPS for the strongest, slowest or OBJCLASS most appropriate to be new FORMATIONLEADER. This is usually performed after the existing FORMATIONLEADER has been destroyed.
Set the desired property to TRUE and remaining properties to FALSE.
This command does not assign a new FORMATIONLEADER, it only determines the best candidate.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To assign a SHIP as FORMATIONLEADER,give formation leadership to,Ship Property}
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is a FORMATIONLEADER, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Promotes the SHIP $0 to {PROPERTY:leader} of the FORMATION to which it belongs.
Returns TRUE if succesful, otherwise this command returns FALSE.

Returns TRUE if the OBJ $2 is within {PROPERTY:firing range} of TURRET $3 of the SHIP $0, otherwise it returns FALSE.
{ABOUT_GUNS_AND_TURRETS}

Returns a random {PROPERTY:enemy} SHIP within {PROPERTY:firing range} of TURRET $2 of the SHIP $0, if any, otherwise it returns NULL.
{ABOUT_GUNS_AND_TURRETS}
Returns the MISSILE WARE currently installed on the SHIP $0, if any, otherwise it returns NULL.
Returns the most appropriate MISSILE WARE with which to attack the OBJ $2, out of the current MISSILES aboard the SHIP $0.
Returns the most appropriate MISSILE WARE with which to attack the OBJ $1.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 has the MISSILE WARE $2 in it`s cargo bay and is capable of firing them, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Returns the {PROPERTY:missile fire probability} of the SHIP $0, as a {UNITS:percentage}.
{NOT_IMPLEMENTED}
Sets the {PROPERTY:missile fire probability} {UNITS:percentage} of the SHIP $0.
{NOT_IMPLEMENTED}

Returns TRUE if the LASER $2 is compatible with TURRET $2 of the SHIP $0, otherwise this command returns FALSE.
{ABOUT_GUNS_AND_TURRETS}

Returns the maximum number of GUNS that can be held in TURRET $2 of the SHIP $0.
{ABOUT_GUNS_AND_TURRETS}

Returns the number of TURRETS on the SHIP $0.
{ABOUT_GUNS_AND_TURRETS}
Returns a new ARRAY containing all the SHIPS in the FORMATION of which the SHIP $0 is a member. If the SHIP is not in a FORMATION, this command returns NULL.
Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:jump distance} that a SHIP $0, OWNEDBY to a STATION, will travel to buy or sell WARES.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 has WARES onboard that are {PROPERTY:illegal} in the SECTORS OWNEDBY by the RACE $2, otherwise this command returns FALSE.
Sets the {PROPERTY:homebase} of the SHIP $0 to the {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION $1.
Returns the maximum number of {PROPERTY:upgrades} of the {PROPERTY:installed component} WARE $2 that can be installed on the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:homebase} of the SHIP $0, if any, otherwise this commands returns NULL.
Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:speed} of the OBJ $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:maximum speed} of the SHIP $0, assuming all {OBJECT:Engine Tunings} were installed.
Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:laser energy}, in {UNITS:Joules}, of all the GUNS in the TURRET of the OBJ $0.

Adds or removes the SHIP $0 as the {PROPERTY:wingman} of the player`s SHIP.
Set $1 to TRUE to add the SHIP $0 as the {PROPERTY:wingman} and FALSE to remove.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 if the {PROPERTY:wingman} of the player`s SHIP, and FALSE otherwise.

Buys a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 into the cargo bay of the SHIP $0 from the STATION at which the SHIP is docked.
If there is insufficient {PROPERTY:cargo bay space} or the STATION does not have $2 {UNITS:units} for sale, the maximum allowable number of {UNITS:units} are transferred.
If the SHIP $0 has a {PROPERTY:homebase}, the cost of the purchase is deducted from the {PROPERTY:homebase account}, otherwise it is deducted from the {PROPERTY:player account}.
This command returns the actual number of {UNITS:units} bought.

Buys a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 into the cargo bay of the SHIP $0 from the STATION at which the SHIP is docked, but only if the {PROPERTY:ware price} is less than or equal to $4y credits.
If there is insufficient {PROPERTY:cargo bay space} or the STATION does not have $2 {UNITS:units} for sale, the maximum allowable number of {UNITS:units} are transferred.
If the SHIP $0 has a {PROPERTY:homebase}, the cost of the purchase is deducted from the {PROPERTY:homebase account}, otherwise it is deducted from the {PROPERTY:player account}.
This command returns the actual number of {UNITS:units} bought.

Sells a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 from the cargo bay of the SHIP $0 to the STATION at which the SHIP is docked.
If $2 is more than the {PROPERTY:ware quantity} aboard the SHIP, or the STATION does not have enough {PROPERTY:cargo bay space} for $2 {UNITS:units}, the maximum allowable number of {UNITS:units} are transferred.
If the SHIP $0 has a {PROPERTY:homebase}, the money from the sale is added to the {PROPERTY:homebase account}, otherwise it is added to the {PROPERTY:player account}.
This command returns the actual number of {UNITS:units} sold.
Returns the largest {TYPE:transport class} that the SHIP $0 can hold.
Returns the {PROPERTY:volume} of occupied and unoccupied cargo bay space of the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:volume} of the unoccupied cargo bay space of the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:volume} occupied by the WARE $2 in the cargo bay and as {PROPERTY:installed components} of the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:volume} occupied by the WARE $2 in the cargo bay of the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:volume} of the WARE $2 that could potentially fit in the unoccupied cargo space of the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:volume} of the occupied cargo bay space of the SHIP $0.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is capable of transporting the WARE $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns the total {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of the WARE $2 in the cargo bay and as {PROPERTY:installed components} of the SHIP $0.
Returns the total {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of the WARE $2 in the cargo bay of the SHIP $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:quantity} of the WARE $2 that could potentially fit in the unoccupied cargo space of the SHIP $0.

Returns the potential {PROPERTY:quantity} of the WARE $2 that would be contained in the cargo bay of the SHIP $0, if all the remaining space were filled with the WARE $2.
This includes any of the WARE $2 that is already in the cargo bay.

Transfers a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 into the cargo bay of the SHIP $0 from the STATION at which the SHIP is docked.
If there is insufficient {PROPERTY:cargo bay space} or the STATION does not have $2 {UNITS:units} for sale, the maximum allowable number of {UNITS:units} are transferred.
No money is exchanged in this transaction.
This command returns the actual number of {UNITS:units} transferred.

Transfers a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 from the cargo bay of the SHIP $0 to the STATION at which the SHIP is docked.
If $2 is more than the {PROPERTY:ware quantity} aboard the SHIP, or the STATION does not have enough {PROPERTY:cargo bay space} for $2 {UNITS:units}, the maximum allowable number of {UNITS:units} are transferred.
No money is exchanged in this transaction.
This command returns the actual number of {UNITS:units} transferred.

Adds a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 to the cargo bay of the SHIP $0.
If the {PROPERTY:ware quantity} $2 is a negative INTEGER, the WARES are removed.

Installs a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $2 {UNITS:units} of the WARE $3 to the SHIP $0 as {PROPERTY:installed components}.
If the {PROPERTY:ware quantity} $2 is a negative INTEGER, the WARES are removed.

Returns the {PROPERTY:ware quantity} that is sought by the SHIP $0, when executing a {CONSTANT:\[COMMAND_GET_WARE\]} or {CONSTANT:\[COMMAND_GET_WARE_BEST\]} command.
This must have been previously set by the {COMMAND:set wanted ware count to ...} command.

Returns the WARE that is sought by the SHIP $0, when executing a {CONSTANT:\[COMMAND_GET_WARE\]} or {CONSTANT:\[COMMAND_GET_WARE_BEST\]} command.
This must have been previously set by the {COMMAND:set wanted ware to ...} command.
Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of the WARE $2 that can be stored in the DOCK $0.
Returns the maximum {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of the WARE $2 that can be stored in the FACTORY $0.
Returns TRUE if the STATION $0 can buy the WARE $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the STATION $0 can sell the WARE $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns the current {PROPERTY:ware price} of the WARE $2 at the STATION $0, in {UNITS:credits}.

Returns the {PROPERTY:average ware price} of the WARE $2, sold at the STATION $0, in {UNITS:credits}.
{COMMAND_NAME_CHANGED:get average price of ware}
Sets the current {PROPERTY:ware price} of the WARE $2, sold at the STATION $0, to $1 {UNITS:credits}.
Returns TRUE if the STATION $0 buys the WARE $2 as a PRIMARYRESOURCE, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the STATION $0 buys the WARE $2 as a SECONDARYRESOURCE, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the STATION $0 buys or sells the WARE $2, and FALSE otherwise.

Returns the WARE that is produced by the FACTORY $0.
If this command is used on a DOCK or SHIPYARD, it will return NULL.
Returns the total number of {PROPERTY:primary resources} and {PROPERTY:secondary resources} bought by the STATION $0.
Returns the number of {PROPERTY:primary resources} bought by the STATION $0.
Returns the number of {PROPERTY:secondary resources} bought by the STATION $0.
Returns TRUE if only {PROPERTY:player owned} SHIPS are allowed to trade with the STATION $0, and FALSE otherwise.

Returns a new ARRAY containing all the WARES that are bought and sold by the STATION $0.
The ARRAY contains the PRODUCTS first, then {PROPERTY:primary resources} followed by {PROPERTY:secondary resources}.

Adds $1 {UNITS:credits} to the {PROPERTY:station account} of the STATION $0.
If $1 is a negative INTEGER, the {UNITS:credits} are deducted.
Returns the number of {UNITS:credits} in the {PROPERTY:station account} of the STATION $0.
Adds the WARE $1 to the list of PRODUCTS sold by the STATION $0.
Adds the WARE $1 to the list of {PROPERTY:primary resources} bought by the STATION $0.
Adds the WARE $1 to the list of {PROPERTY:secondary resources} bought by the STATION $0.

Activates or deactives the production timers of the STATION $0.
The timers are activated if $1 is TRUE, and deactivated if $1 is FALSE.
{HEADING:Information}
This is designed for use with the {COMMAND:create station} command, which creates STATIONS in a `deactivated` state to give the script time to add WARES to the station.
Removes the WARE $1 from the list of PRODUCTS sold by the STATION $0.
Removes the WARE $1 from the list of {PROPERTY:primary resources} sold by the STATION $0.
Removes the WARE $1 from the list of {PROPERTY:secondary resources} sold by the STATION $0
Commands the STATION $0 to launch {CLASS:Fighters} to attack the OBJ $1.
Adds a SHIP $2 with OBJCLASS {CLASS:Big Ship} to the SHIPYARD $0 as a DOCKED vessel.
Returns the {PROPERTY:enemy} SHIP closest to the object $0 that is within $2 {UNITS:meters}. If there are none within this range it returns NULL.
Returns the {PROPERTY:enemy} STATION closest to the object $0 that is within $2 {UNITS:meters}. If there are none within this range it returns NULL.
Returns the distance in {UNITS:meters} between the object $0 and the {PROPERTY:position} with co-ordinates \(x, y, z\).
Return TRUE if the SECTOR $0 has been discovered by the player, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Returns the northern JUMPGATE in the SECTOR $0. If there is no northern JUMPGATE it returns NULL.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve the JUMPGATE for any direction with a single command,get warp gate: gate id,Universe Data}

Returns the southern JUMPGATE in the SECTOR $0. If there is no southern JUMPGATE it returns NULL.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve the JUMPGATE for any direction with a single command,get warp gate: gate id,Universe Data}

Returns the eastern JUMPGATE in the SECTOR $0. If there is no eastern JUMPGATE it returns NULL.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve the JUMPGATE for any direction with a single command,get warp gate: gate id,Universe Data}

Returns the western JUMPGATE in the SECTOR $0. If there is no western JUMPGATE it returns NULL.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve the JUMPGATE for any direction with a single command,get warp gate: gate id,Universe Data}

Returns a randomly chosen SECTOR belonging to the RACE $3 that is a maximum {PROPERTY:jump distance} of $2 from the SECTOR $1.
To retrieve a SECTOR from any RACE, set $3 to NULL.
{HEADING:Information}
All {PROPERTY:jump distances} are zero-based.

Returns the JUMPGATE in the SECTOR $0 with a {PROPERTY:jump gate ID} of $2. If there is no JUMPGATE with that {PROPERTY:jump gate ID} it returns NULL.
{ABOUT_JUMPGATE_ID}
Returns a new ARRAY containing all SHIPS within the SECTOR, {CLASS:Carrier} or STATION $0.
Returns a new ARRAY containing all STATIONS in the SECTOR $0.
Returns a new ARRAY containing all DOCKS in the SECTOR $0.
Returns a new ARRAY containing all SHIPS OWNEDBY the player in the SECTOR $0.
Returns a new ARRAY containing all STATIONS OWNEDBY the player in the SECTOR $0.
Returns a new ARRAY containing all {TYPE:asteroids} in the SECTOR $0.
Returns the {PROPERTY:unit volume} of the WARE $1.
Returns the {TYPE:transport class} of the WARE $1.

Returns the {PROPERTY:average price} of the WARE $1.
The {PROPERTY:average price} if the average of the {PROPERTY:minimum price} and {PROPERTY:maximum price}.
Returns the {PROPERTY:maximum price} of the WARE $1.
Returns the {PROPERTY:minimum price} of the WARE $1.
Returns the {PROPERTY:maximum price} of the WARE $1 when bought as a {PROPERTY:secondary resource} of a STATION.
Returns the {PROPERTY:minimum price} of the WARE $1 when bought as a {PROPERTY:secondary resource} of a STATION.
Returns TRUE if the WARE $1 is {PROPERTY:illegal} within the SECTORS OWNEDBY the RACE $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns the MAINTYPE of the WARE $1.
Returns the SUBTYPE of the WARE $1.

Returns the WARE with the MAINTYPE $1x and SUBTYPE $2y, if any, otherwise this command returns NULL.
{RELATED_SCRIPT_OBJECT_LIST:MAINTYPES,Constants}
Returns the {PROPERTY:firing range} of the MISSILE WARE $1, in {UNITS:meters}.

Returns the {PROPERTY:engine version} of the current game, which uniquely identifies the game version and any patches.
{HEADING:Engine Versions}
{CONSTANT:44} - {X3TC} v2.5 and above {CONSTANT:40} - {X3TC} v2.0
{CONSTANT:33} - {X3R} v2.5 and above {CONSTANT:32} - {X3R} v2.0 {CONSTANT:28} - {X3R} v1.4 {CONSTANT:25} - {X3R} v1.3
{CONSTANT:25} - {X2} v1.2 and above

Sets the {PROPERTY:global variable} with the name $0 to the value $1. If the variable does not exist, it is created.
{ABOUT_LOCAL_AND_GLOBAL_VARIABLES}

Returns the value of the {PROPERTY:global variable} with the name $0. If the variable does not exist, this command returns NULL.
{ABOUT_LOCAL_AND_GLOBAL_VARIABLES}

Registers the script $0 as an AL_PLUGIN.
{ABOUT_AL_PLUGINS}

Unregisters the previously registered script $0 as no longer being an AL_PLUGIN.
{ABOUT_AL_PLUGINS}

Sets the name of the AL_PLUGIN $0 to the STRING $1. This name is displayed to the user in the 'Manage AL Plugins' menu.
{ABOUT_AL_PLUGINS}

Sets the frequency of 'timer' events sent to the AL_PLUGIN $0 to $1 seconds.
{ABOUT_AL_PLUGINS}

Sets the {PROPERTY:fighting skill} of the OBJ $0 to the INTEGER $1.
The {PROPERTY:fighting skill} ranges from 0 \(terrible\) to 28 \(best\) and determines the quality of the maneuvers performed during combat.

Returns an INTEGER containing the {PROPERTY:fighting skill} of the OBJ $0.
The {PROPERTY:fighting skill} ranges from 0 \(terrible\) to 28 \(best\) and determines the quality of the maneuvers performed during combat.
Returns a STRING containing the {PROPERTY:name} of the PILOT of the SHIP $0.
Returns a STRING containing a randomly generated name appropriate for the RACE $1.

Sets the voice and appearance of the PILOT of the SHIP $0, when seen during a communications message.
The {PROPERTY:voice} is an INTEGER between 0 and 7 correlating to the RACE variation strings in the main language file.
The {PROPERTY:face} $2x is the INTEGER ID of the video displayed, correlating to the videos in the main video file.
If the {PROPERTY:pirate subrace} $3y is TRUE then the appropriate pirate variations are used instead.
The {PROPERTY:argon female} $4z is unknown, but may related to the ATMO/Betty docking computer.
{RELATED_MEDIA:speech clips}

Destroys the OBJ $0. If $1 is TRUE and the OBJ is in the same SECTOR as the player then an explosion is shown, otherwise it is not.{CORRECTION:Jack08}{HEADING:Information}
Destroying an OBJ without an explosion is used for destroying {TERMINOLOGY:OOS} \(Out-of-Sector\) OBJS.

Instantly moves the OBJ $0 into the SECTOR or STATION $1.
If $1 is a STATION then the SHIP $0 must be of the OBJCLASS {CLASS:Little Ship}.
Unconditionally jumps to the line of code containing the label specified by $0

Yields execution to other scripts for a random period of between $1 and $2 {UNITS:milliseconds}.
{COMMAND_INTERRUPTABLE}

Outputs a value $2 to the {TYPE:logfile} with ID $0x.
If $1y is TRUE, contents of the {TYPE:logfile} are appended, otherwise they are replaced.
{HEADING:Information}
The {TYPE:logfile} is created in the game folder and named `log<id>.txt`.

Outputs a STRING generated from a template $2 to the {TYPE:logfile} with ID $0x.
The template can contain up to 5 parameter fields, denoted by `%s`, which are relaced by the arguments $3o, $4x, $5y, $6z and $7a.
If $1y is TRUE, contents of the {TYPE:logfile} are appended, otherwise they are replaced.
{HEADING:Information}
The {TYPE:logfile} is created in the game folder and named `log<id>.txt`.

Outputs a STRING generated from a template, stored in a language strings file, to the {TYPE:logfile} with ID $0x.
The template STRING with ID $3z is loaded from page $2y.
The template can contain up to 5 parameter fields, denoted by `%s`, which are relaced by the arguments $4o, $5x, $6y, $7z and $8a.
If $1y is TRUE, contents of the {TYPE:logfile} are appended, otherwise they are replaced.
{HEADING:Information}
The {TYPE:logfile} is created in the game folder and named `log<id>.txt`.

Plays the sound effect with ID $0.
{RELATED_MEDIA:sound effects}

Plays the speech clips with ID $0.
This command is very limited in functionality, see {COMMAND:speak text:} for a more effective way of playing speech clips.
{HEADING:Supported Speech Clips}
{CONSTANT:\[IncomingTransmission.Greeting\]} - `We are being hailed` {CONSTANT:\[IncomingTransmission.Message\]} - `Incoming message` {CONSTANT:\[IncomingTransmission.Scanned\]} - `We are scanned` {CONSTANT:\[IncomingTransmission.SOS\]} - `Emergency message from xyz`

Displays a video and plays a speech clip that appears to originating from the OBJ $0.
This command can be used to display any voiced message from the `Race Variation` speech clips.
{HEADING:Constants}
{CONSTANT:\[Comm.DLG_C_START_FIGHTING\]} - Ship about to attack {CONSTANT:\[Comm.DLG_POL_ILLEGAL_GOODS\]} - Illegal goods detected {CONSTANT:\[Comm.DLG_POL_LAST_WARNING\]} - Final warning {CONSTANT:\[Comm.DLG_POL_LEGAL_GOODS\]} - No illegal goods detected

Adds the STRING $0 to the player`s message log.
If $1 is TRUE the message is displayed in a popup window, if FALSE the player is simply notified.

{NOT_IMPLEMENTED}
Use {COMMAND:write to player logbook} instead.

Returns the raw NOTORIETY value between the {PROPERTY:owner race} of the OBJ $0 and the RACE $2.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns the raw NOTORIETY value between the RACE $1 and the RACE $2.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns TRUE if the {X2} plot is currently in the {PROPERTY:state} $2.
{SEE_HANDBOOK:plot states}

Returns the current {PROPERTY:aggression level} of Kha`ak, as a {UNITS:percentage}.
{HEADING:Information}
The Kha`ak {PROPERTY:aggression level} determines the number and size of {OBJECT:Kh`aak Clusters} that spawn randomly in the game.
The default value is 15%.

Sets the current {PROPERTY:aggression level} of Kha`ak to the {UNITS:percentage} $0.
{HEADING:Information}
The Kha`ak {PROPERTY:aggression level} determines the number and size of {OBJECT:Kh`aak Clusters} that spawn randomly in the game.
The default value is 15%.
Returns the {PROPERTY:version} of the currently executing script.
Returns the {PROPERTY:script name} of the currently executing script.

page.title: X3:Reunion - Command Descriptions
page.command: Returns the square root of the INTEGER $1
Forces the OBJ $0 to the {PROPERTY:position} at co-ordinates \(x, y, z\).
Sets the {PROPERTY:hull energy} of the OBJ $0 to $1
Sets the {PROPERTY:shield energy} of the OBJ $0 to $1
Returns TRUE if the player has ever detected the OBJ $0, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Sets whether the OBJ $0 has ever been detected by the player to TRUE or FALSE.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 can be displayed in the sector map user interface, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Returns TRUE if the TL_OBJECT is currently {PROPERTY:hired} for work, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Returns a new ARRAY containing all the {TYPE:missiles} that are flying towards the object $0.
Returns TRUE if the ASTEROID $0 has been {PROPERTY:scanned} thereby revealing it`s {PROPERTY:mineral yield}, otherwise it returns FALSE.
Marks the ASTEROID $0 as {PROPERTY:scanned} if $1 is TRUE, otherwise as {PROPERTY:unscanned}.
Returns the {PROPERTY:quantity} of the WARE within the {TYPE:flying ware} $0.
Returns the WARE that would be received from mining the ASTEROID $0.
Return TRUE if the DEBRIS $0 has {TYPE:collectible rocks}, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Returns the {PROPERTY:morale} of the PILOT in the SHIP $0.
The {PROPERTY:morale} is an INTEGER between 0 and 25 that represents their resistance to bailing.

Returns the {PROPERTY:aggression} of the PILOT in the SHIP $0.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Sets the {PROPERTY:morale} of the PILOT in the SHIP $0 to the INTEGER $1.
The {PROPERTY:morale} is an INTEGER between 0 and 25 that represents their resistance to bailing.

Sets the {PROPERTY:aggression} of the PILOT in the SHIP $0 to the INTEGER $1.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Returns the {PROPERTY:trade skill} of the PILOT in the SHIP $0.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Sets the {PROPERTY:trade skill} of the PILOT in the SHIP $0 to the INTEGER $1.
{UNDOCUMENTED}
Returns the OBJ currently targeted by the player, if any, otherwise it returns NULL.
Sets the current target of the player to the OBJ $0.

Returns the raw NOTORIETY value of the player`s {PROPERTY:fight rank}.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns the raw NOTORIETY value of the player`s {PROPERTY:trade rank}.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}
Returns a STRING containing the {PROPERTY:name} of the player.
Returns the current maximum {PROPERTY:speed} of the OBJ $0.
Returns the length of the STRING $1, in characters

Returns a new STRING created from an existing STRING $1x, with all the occurrences of the {PROPERTY:sub-string} $2y replaced with the {PROPERTY:sub-string} $3z. If no occurrences of {PROPERTY:sub-string} $2y were found then the command returns -1.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Creates and returns new DEBRIS of SUBTYPE $1x in the SECTOR $2 containing the WARE $3y with a {PROPERTY:ware quantity} of $4z. If this command fails then it returns NULL.
{COORDINATES:DEBRIS,5xª,6yª,7zª}

Returns the destination SECTOR or destination JUMPGATE associated with the JUMPGATE $0.
If $2 is TRUE the command returns the destination SECTOR, if $2 is FALSE the command returns the destination JUMPGATE.

Returns the {PROPERTY:jump gate ID} of the JUMPGATE $0.
{ABOUT_JUMPGATE_ID}

Returns a new ARRAY containing all the SHIPS with the OBJCLASS or OBJTYPE $2 which are OWNEDBY the RACE $0. If $2 is NULL then SHIPS of any OBJCLASS and any OBJTYPE are returned.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve all the SHIPS MANUFACTUREDBY a RACE,get ship type array: maker race,Universe Data}
Returns a new ARRAY containing all the STATIONS with the OBJCLASS or OBJTYPE $2 which are OWNEDBY the RACE $0. If $2 is NULL then STATIONS of any OBJCLASS and any OBJTYPE are returned.

Updates the {PROPERTY:relation} between the OBJ $0 and the player according to the current NOTORIETY between them.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Displays the question STRING $0 to the player in a popup window, and calls the script $1 with the user`s choosen answer.
The script $1 should contain a STRING argument which will contain the ID of the button pressed.

Adds the question STRING $0 to the player`s message log, and calls the script $1 when the user chooses an answer.
If $2 is TRUE the message is displayed in a popup window, if FALSE the player is simply notified.
The script $1 should contain a STRING argument which will contain the ID of the button pressed.
ADD NEW STOCK REGARDING CHANGED SYNTAX. http://forum.egosoft.com/viewtopic.php?t=287999 Adds merchant to a station.

page.title: X3:Terran Conflict - Command Descriptions
page.command: Reverses the order of the elements in the ARRAY $1 and returns the reversed ARRAY $1. This command reverses the elements within $1, it does not generate a copy of the ARRAY containing the elements in reverse order.
Compares the size and contents of two ARRAYS. Returns TRUE if the elements in ARRAY $1x have the same value and order as the elements in $2y, otherwise it returns FALSE.

Compares the INTEGERS $1o, $2x, $3y, $4z, $5a and returns whichever is the largest.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To determine the smallest of a set of INTEGERS,get minimum,Maths}
Returns TRUE if the PASSENGER or ASTRONAUT $1 is a MARINE. Returns FALSE if $1 is not a MARINE, or $1 is not a PASSENGER or an ASTRONAUT.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Returns the {PROPERTY:number of decks} of the SHIP $0, which determines it`s capability to resist MARINES while fighting the crew.
{ABOUT_BOARDING_PROCEDURE}

Returns the maximum number of MARINES that can be used to board the SHIP $0 using the {COMMAND:add marine to attack group on ship} command.
{ABOUT_BOARDING_TARGETS}

Returns the number of MARINES that have boarded the SHIP $0 and are currently attacking the crew. Returns 0 if the MARINES have not yet boarded the SHIP $0, or there are no MARINES attempting board.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve the MARINES attacking a SHIP,get incoming marines,Marines}

Returns the {PROPERTY:trading price} of the MARINE $0, in credits. This is calculated from his {PROPERTY:boarding skills}, with higher skills resulting in a higher price.
{RELATED_COMMAND_2:To change or retrieve individual skills,get marine skill,set marine skill,Marines}
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Destroys the OBJ $0. If $2 is FALSE and the OBJ is in the same SECTOR as the player then an explosion is shown, otherwise it is not.
The OBJ $1 is registered as responsible for the destruction.
{HEADING:Information}
Destroying an OBJ without an explosion is used for destroying {TERMINOLOGY:OOS} \(Out-of-Sector\) OBJS.
Destroys the SHIP $0 with the illusion that it jumped away.

Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is within the same SECTOR as the player, and FALSE otherwise.
{COMPATIBILITY_2:X3TC,X3AP}
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is close enough to use a {OBJECT:Freight Scanner} on the SHIP $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is close enough to use a {OBJECT:Transporter} on the SHIP $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is close enough to use a {OBJECT:Mineral Scanner} on the ASTEROID $2, and FALSE otherwise.
Returns the RACE which {PROPERTY:manufactured} the OBJ $0.

Returns the title or index of the {PROPERTY:notoriety rank} between the OBJ $0 and the RACE or CORPORATION $2, as a STRING if $3 is TRUE or an INTEGER if $3 is FALSE.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns the progress of the OBJ $0 towards their next {PROPERTY:notoriety rank} with the RACE or CORPORATION $2, as a percentage.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}
Returns the quantity of {TYPE:collectable rocks} within the {TYPE:debris} $0.

Returns the title or index of the player`s {PROPERTY:trade rank}, as a STRING if $1 is TRUE or an INTEGER if $1 is FALSE.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns the title or index of the player`s {PROPERTY:fight rank}, as a STRING if $1 is TRUE or an INTEGER if $1 is FALSE.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns the player`s progress towards their next {PROPERTY:trade rank} as a percentage.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}

Returns the player`s progress towards their next {PROPERTY:fight rank} as a percentage.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}
Returns TRUE if the player is in hyperspace and FALSE otherwise.
Commands the PILOT to eject from the SHIP $0, causing the SHIP $0 to become {PROPERTY:neutral}.
{UNDOCUMENTED}
Sets the {PROPERTY:speed} of the SHIP $0 to $1 {UNITS:m/s}.
Sets the {PROPERTY:laser energy} of TURRET 0 of the OBJ $0 to $1 {UNITS:joules}.
Returns the range of the {OBJECT:Freight Scanner} in {UNITS:meters}.
Returns the range of the {OBJECT:Transporter} in {UNITS:meters}.
Returns the range of the {OBJECT:Mineral Scanner} in {UNITS:meters}.
Returns the RACE which {PROPERTY:manufactures} the SHIP $1.
Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 is a {PROPERTY:civilian} ship and FALSE otherwise.

Returns TRUE if the SHIP $0 can be boarded by MARINES, otherwise it returns FALSE.
{ABOUT_BOARDING_TARGETS}

Returns the {PROPERTY:variation} of a SHIP $0. eg. Raider, Sentinel, Vanguard.
Matching titles can be found in page 17, starting with string ID 10,000.

Returns the {PROPERTY:variation} of a SHIP of OBJTYPE $1. eg. Raider, Sentinel, Vanguard.
Matching titles can be found in page 17, starting with string ID 10,000.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is {PROPERTY:invincible} and FALSE otherwise.
This property can only be set using a {MD} script.
{UNDOCUMENTED}
{UNDOCUMENTED}

Determines whether a STRING in a language strings file is present. Returns TRUE if the STRING exists and has been loaded using the {COMMAND:load text:} command, otherwise it returns FALSE. This command will also return FALSE if the STRING contains formatting errors or is unavailable in the user`s current language.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To load a custom language strings file,load text:,Strings}

Returns a new STRING containing the STRING representation of the INTEGER $1.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To convert a STRING containing numbers into an INTEGER,string to integer,Strings}

Returns TRUE if the SECTOR $0 is a {PROPERTY:core sector}, and FALSE if $0 is a {PROPERTY:border sector} or an {PROPERTY:unknown sector}.
{ABOUT_SECTOR_SECURITY}

Returns a new ARRAY containing all the SHIPS with the OBJCLASS $2 which are MANUFACTUREDBY the RACE $0. If $2 is NULL then SHIPS of any OBJCLASS are returned.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To retrieve all the SHIPS OWNEDBY a RACE,get ship array: of race,Universe Data}
Sets the destination of the JUMPGATE $0 to the JUMPGATE $1.

Returns a new ARRAY containing all the FACTORIES that sell the WARE $1.
{HEADING:Information}
If $2 is FALSE then only FACTORIES that have the WARE in {PROPERTY:stock} are returned, if $2 is TRUE then all FACTORIES that sell the WARE $1 are returned.
This command does not work on DOCKS.

Returns a new ARRAY containing all the STATIONS that trade the WARE $1 as a {PROPERTY:primary resource} or {PROPERTY:secondary resource}.
{HEADING:Information}
If $2 is FALSE then only STATIONS that have the WARE in {PROPERTY:stock} are returned, if $2 is TRUE then all STATIONS that sell the WARE $1 are returned.
The WARES traded by DOCKS are classed as resources, so this command can be used on DOCKS and FACTORIES, unlike {COMMAND:get station array: product} which only works on FACTORIES.

Returns a new ARRAY containing all the {TYPE:mines}, {TYPE:satellites} and {TYPE:orbital lasers} in the SECTOR $0. If $2 is TRUE then {TYPE:asteroids} are also returned, whereas if $2 is FALSE then they are not.

Returns a new ARRAY of all SECTORS with a maximum {PROPERTY:jump distance} of $2x from the OBJ $0.
If $3y is TRUE then only SECTORS {PROPERTY:known} to the player are returned.
{HEADING:Information}
All {PROPERTY:jump distances} are zero-based.
Returns TRUE if the OBJ $0 is a {OBJECT:Military Output} and FALSE otherwise.

Returns the raw NOTORIETY value required to buy the WARE $1.
{ABOUT_NOTORIETY}
Returns TRUE if the WARE $1 is a {PROPERTY:component} such as {OBJECT:Duplex Scanner} or {OBJECT:5MW Shield} and FALSE otherwise.
Returns TRUE if the WARE $1 is an {PROPERTY:upgrade} such as {OBJECT:Engine Tunings} or {OBJECT:Police License} and FALSE otherwise.

page.title: X3:Albion Prelude - Command Descriptions
page.command:
Compares the INTEGERS $1o, $2x, $3y, $4z, $5a and returns whichever is the smallest.
{RELATED_COMMAND:To determine the largest of a set of INTEGERS,get maximum,Maths}

Returns TRUE when the player is in SECTOR $0 and FALSE otherwise. It may also return FALSE if the player is within SECTOR $0 but DOCKED at a STATION.
{UNDOCUMENTED}

page.title: Object Classes
page.t: Components of the galaxy such as PLANETS, {TYPE:stars} and NEBULAE, as well as unique objects used in the plot.
